footer.tagline: Upgrading cybersecurity with explainable multi-agent systems

preview.banner: ColleaiQ is under active development. Write to kontakt@colleaiq.dk

hero.headline: Where artificial intelligence rehearses real attacks
hero.paragraph1: Most security tools watch logs and infrastructure and wait for something to look wrong. They are useful for alerts and policy checks, yet they rarely explore how an attacker could actually move through your systems. Weak paths can stay invisible for a long time simply because nobody has walked them end to end.
hero.paragraph2: ColleaiQ is built from the ground up as a multi-agent system for cybersecurity. A coordinated network of specialised AI agents work together: some read new exposures and understand how they relate to your setup, others plan and execute realistic attack paths in a safe sandbox, and others collect traces and turn them into a clear story. A human analyst reviews the results with you, so the agents handle the heavy exploration while risk appetite and final decisions stay human.
hero.latestPost: Latest post: The US And China Are Pouring Money Into AI Hacking. Where Does That Leave Europe? →

challenge.headline: The challenge
challenge.paragraph1: Talk to people who work with security today and a few themes repeat themselves. There are more systems, more identities and more integrations than ever. Cloud services, operational technology, third-party providers and older infrastructure all end up on the same attack surface, yet they are rarely tested as one connected whole.
challenge.paragraph2:
Many teams rely on log platforms, endpoint protection and threat intelligence feeds. These tools are strong at telling you what just happened, or warning when a known indicator appears. They are much less helpful when you want to answer a simple question:

"If someone really tried to get in here this month, where would they start, and how far could they get?"
challenge.paragraph3: That kind of end-to-end rehearsal is usually reserved for manual red-team exercises a few times a year. At the same time, rules such as NIS2 expect documented risk management, testing activity and clear decision trails, while experienced security people are in short supply.

howItWorks.headline: How ColleaiQ works in practice
howItWorks.description:
ColleaiQ is built around one idea: security improves when you can safely test how things fail.

In pilots today, we work with you to create a sandbox that mirrors key parts of your environment. Our multi-agent system then follows a simple rhythm:

**1. Plan realistic paths**
A group of reader and planner agents take a newly published exposure or a scenario we agree together and propose one or more plausible ways an attacker could move through your environment.

**2. Rehearse them safely**
Orchestration agents walk those paths step by step inside the sandbox, never on live systems, and record what actually happens at each stage: which actions succeed, which controls react and where the path stalls.

**3. Turn it into actions**
Reporting agents assemble a short, evidence-based finding: which systems were involved, what the impact was in the sandbox, and which changes would have blocked the path.

A human analyst from our side reviews each result with you. Over time, these rehearsals build up a concrete picture of how exposures behave in your specific setup instead of staying abstract.

whyTeams.headline: Why teams try ColleaiQ
whyTeams.description:
Teams use ColleaiQ because multi-agent rehearsals take on the slow discovery work and come back with something concrete.

In the current alpha, ColleaiQ can:

• track selected newly published vulnerabilities that are relevant for your technology stack

• run rehearsals for agreed exposures in a sandbox that mirrors important parts of your environment

• produce short reports that link each rehearsal to affected systems and suggested changes

Every run is signed off by a human analyst. You get fewer "maybe" findings and more specific examples such as: "here is what we tried in the sandbox, here is how far it went under your current setup, and here is what would have stopped it."
whyTeams.imageAlt1: Security workflow with a clear audit trail

whatYouGet.headline: What you can use today
whatYouGet.description:
ColleaiQ is in alpha with pilot customers. We prefer to be clear about what is ready now and what is still in progress.

Right now, you can expect:

• multi-agent, exposure-driven rehearsals for selected newly published vulnerabilities

• safe sandbox runs that never touch production systems

• evidence-first findings that show attempt → observation → suggested fix

• lightweight integrations with existing tools such as Velociraptor, endpoint protection and log platforms, plus export into your case or ticket system

We are still early. Some things require our hands-on help, and we only take on a small number of pilots at a time. The upside is that you can influence how the product grows.

rehearsal.headline: Safe rehearsal: exposure → sandbox → observations
rehearsal.description:
When a relevant exposure appears, we work with you to decide whether it is worth rehearsing. If it is, ColleaiQ sets up a realistic path in the sandbox and runs it step by step.

You see what was attempted, what actually worked inside the sandbox, and where risk tends to concentrate in your environment under that scenario.
rehearsal.imageAlt: Safe rehearsal flow from exposure to observations

learning.headline: Analyst approval and learning loop
learning.description:
For each rehearsal, the platform suggests one or more fixes. A human analyst reviews the suggestion with you, and you decide what is realistic to change.

That judgement – what you chose to do and why – feeds back into the system. Over time, this helps the agents focus on the types of paths and recommendations that match your risk appetite and constraints.

compliance.headline: Compliance & documentation
compliance.description:
Every rehearsal links attempt → evidence → impact → decision.

This structure supports NIS2 work by giving you documentation for risk management and testing activity. We do not certify or replace your legal advisors. We provide artefacts and traceability that make it easier to show what was tested, what you learned and how you responded.
compliance.imageAlt: Structured finding with evidence and decision log

builtFor.headline: Who we build for
builtFor.ciso:
**Security and risk leaders**
A way to validate your posture regularly and explain results in a few slides, backed by artefacts that hold up in audits and board discussions.
builtFor.redTeams:
**Red teams and internal testers**
Let the platform handle routine reconnaissance and repeatable paths, so you can focus on creative scenarios and bespoke tradecraft.
builtFor.regulated:
**Regulated organisations**
Repeatable rehearsals and clear evidence for sectors such as finance, healthcare and critical infrastructure, where you need both resilience and documentation.

fromLab.headline: From the lab
fromLab.postExcerpt: We rehearse attacks in a sandbox that mirrors production—never on live systems—and deliver evidence, impact, and a practical fix for human approval.

whyColleaiQ.headline: Why ColleaiQ
whyColleaiQ.point1: Built in Copenhagen with a focus on European workflows, regulation and explainability.
whyColleaiQ.point2: We favour context over raw alerts. Each finding connects an attempted path, what happened in a realistic test and why it matters for your environment.
whyColleaiQ.point3: The system improves with use. Analyst feedback shapes how the agents explore, so each run has the potential to be more relevant than the last.

finalCTA.headline: Ready to rehearse attacks before they happen for real?
finalCTA.description:
If you want rehearsals instead of surprises, let's talk. We will map your setup at a sensible level of detail, agree on what "good enough" looks like for a pilot, and run a small set of explainable, human-approved exercises in a sandbox.

From there we can decide together whether ColleaiQ makes a meaningful difference for your security work.

hero.headline: Our Mission
hero.subtitle: We bridge advanced AI and cybersecurity to create proactive, explainable protection for organizations that cannot wait for the next incident.

vision.headline: Vision
vision.description: 2025 has been called the year of agentic AI. ColleaiQ explores the natural next step: multi-agent networks. Our goal is to make this approach usable in European cybersecurity—so defense can get ahead of threats.

platform.description: Specialized AI agents simulate realistic attacker behavior in secure, contained environments and translate findings into clear, auditable actions your SOC can use.

genesis.title: Genesis
genesis.description: The multi-agent foundation began in support/HR tasks. The complexity fit better in technical domains.

pivot.title: Strategic Pivot
pivot.description: Conversations with Danish IT and security companies pointed to a gap in cybersecurity—here our technology matched the challenge.

innovation.title: Innovation Focus
innovation.description: We build the bridge between AI and security: from agentic AI to collaborative multi-agent networks.

leadership.title: European Leadership
leadership.description: We develop in Denmark with an eye on EU needs, data handling, and documentation requirements.

threat.title: The European threat landscape
threat.description: An intensified security environment demands robust digital infrastructure and operations.

vulnerability.title: Digital vulnerability
vulnerability.description: Denmark is highly digital—the benefits come with increased risk. Many companies are not adequately secured.

wakeup.title: Wake-up call
wakeup.description: NotPetya against Mærsk in 2017 cost up to DKK 2 billion. Downtime costs—even today.

sovereignty.title: Digital sovereignty
sovereignty.description: Danish-developed technology, scalable in the EU, aligned with European sovereignty goals.

mission.description: To become a natural tool in the work for cybersecurity and sovereignty—explainable and secure AI for high-risk sectors such as energy, defense, shipping and critical infrastructure.

hero.headline: Our Solution
hero.subtitle: A multi-agent AI system that defends proactively through continuous attack simulations and explainable recommendations.

multiAgent.title: Multi-agent collaboration
multiAgent.description: Specialized agents work together. "Red" simulates, "blue" monitors and defends.

traceable.title: Traceable recommendations
traceable.description: Every action is explainable and auditable—helps with NIS2 documentation.

learning.title: Continuous learning
learning.description: Agents learn from analyst decisions and results—sharpen rules and focus over time.

architecture.headline: Architecture
architecture.redTeam: Red team agent → simulates threats in sandbox.
architecture.blueTeam: Blue team agent → gathers signals, explains findings and proposes remediation.
architecture.sandbox: Sandbox environment → secure, isolated, mirrors production.
architecture.explainable: Explainable outputs → context, rationale and audit trail.

cycle.headline: Continuous defense cycle — example (Credential Dumping)
cycle.red: Red: simulates LSASS extraction in sandbox
cycle.solution: Solution: generate EDR rule with audit trail

benefits.headline: Benefits
benefits.benefit4: Explainable AI for audit and compliance

technical.headline: Technical Foundation
technical.description: Generative models combined with graph analysis, RL and deterministic logic. Expertise from security specialists is integrated for explainable, credible results.

nis2.headline: NIS2
nis2.description: EU's NIS2 sets stricter requirements for critical infrastructure and essential services. ColleaiQ helps with:
nis2.risk: Continuous risk assessment—proactive simulations find weaknesses early.
nis2.incident: Incident response—explainable recommendations for rapid reaction.
nis2.management: Security management—complete logging and audit trail.
